CNN.com Student News Newsletter






 
Friday, June 1, 2007 



 Watch and Learn
Our last show of the week begins with a report on how a health scare is raising questions about U.S. border security. Then, we meet a Scripps National Spelling Bee contestant whose thoughts were half a world away.
We want to know what you think were the top news stories of the year. Teachers, please send us your ideas at CNN.com/EDUCATION.

 Donor gives $100M for low-income scholarships
A graduate of the University of Chicago gave an anonymous donation of $100 million to his alma mater, marking the largest single donation given to an Illinois university. 

 June 11, 2007 - We Were Warned 
The June 4, 2007, airing of CNN Classroom Edition: We Were Warned: Edge of Disaster has been preempted due to CNN's debate coverage.  You can access a Debate Viewing Guide that can be used with the presidential debates at CNN.com/EDUCATION.

 Week of May 28
1. Iran and the U.S.2. Ambassador to Iraq3. American Civil War4. Tomb of the Unknowns5. solace 6. Sudan7. tuberculosis  8. biodiesel 9. blue moon10. Washington, D.C.




 
CNN Student News is a 10-minute, commercial-free news program that airs on CNN Headline News at 3:12 a.m. EST as well as on CNN.com/EDUCATION. Created by a team of journalists and educators, the program provides the top stories of the day, segments that encourage student participation, and in-depth special reports. In addition, CNN Student News provides free curriculum at CNN.com/EDUCATION to accompany each program's content. CNN Student News, along with CNN Classroom Edition, is Turner Broadcasting's contribution to Cable in the Classroom.
